q.quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
q.author: Charles Dickens

q.quote: Change is the end result of all true learning.
q.author: Leo Buscaglia

q.quote: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
q.author: Mary Schmich

q.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
q.author: Victor Hugo

q.quote: Ye stars! which are the poetry of heaven!
q.author: Lord Byron

q.quote: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
q.author: Rita Rudner

q.quote: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
q.author: Franz Kafka

q.quote: Behind every cloud is another cloud.
q.author: Judy Garland

q.quote: There are a handful of people whom money won't spoil, and we all count ourselves among them.
q.author: Mignon McLaughlin

q.quote: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.
q.author: Napoleon Hill

q.quote: But surely for everything you have to love you have to pay some price.
q.author: Agatha Christie

q.quote: Yes, I'm a great believer in angels.
q.author: Anna Lee

q.quote: Those who do not want to imitate anything, produce nothing.
q.author: Salvador Dali

q.quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
q.author: Logan Pearsall Smith
